result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd A Burg Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:29 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  There are no corrections. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 24 months: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
All prescriptions should be from one pharmacy. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Pay costs.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
If he has not already done so, he is to provide a DNA sample.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 

Count 2 - 
Serve 45 days jail.
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
May be served on electronic monitoring if approved thru the LSI assessment. 
Pay costs, victim witness and filing fee. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 

Count 3 - 
20 days jail, concurrent to COunt 2 
Huber for employment and any counseling he may be involved in. 
May be served on electronic monitoring if approved thru the LSI assessment. 
Pay costs, victim witness and filing fee. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Page 2 is blank and not included in the scan.
Sentencing hearing on January 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF33 and 14CF302

Atty Kryshak indicates he was brought on after the jury trial was completed.  Asks that the sentencing be done in front of Judge Flugaur. 

Parties are to see the judicial assistant to reschedule.
from Atty Renc
Defendant's

23 Exhibits (with Exhibits 1 & 2 returned to the Portage County Sheriff's Dept per statutes).
Re-scan of Exhibit #P3 Photo of Living Room Area
Sentencing hearing on December 16, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Day 2 of Jury Trial.

8:19 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances are same as September 17, 2014.
Court asks parties if there is anything that they would like to put on the record at this time prior to the return of the jurors.
Both parties have nothing to put on the record at this time.
Atty Schmidt states his defendant will not be testifying on his behalf.
Court questions the defendant if he is choosing to not testify in his defense and he is stating that he is not going to testify.  
Defendant is exercising his right to not testify.
Defendant has discussed this with his Attorney.
Evidence is concluded.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds that the defendant has freely and voluntarily excercised his right to not testify on his behalf.

8:22 a.m.  Parties review the Jury Instructions.
Court has provided new Jury Instructions removing paragraph regarding defendant testifying.
8:27 a.m.  Counsel is ready to discuss the Jury Instructions.
Atty Schmidt has a "special" language he would like to discuss on the Jury Instructions.  Atty Schmidt has no other changes or objections.
Atty Cousins has no objections to what is in the Jury Instructions.
Atty Cousins makes statements on the form he would prefer to use regarding 6037B. 
Atty Schmidt makes statements regarding the instructions and 6037B.
Atty Cousins replies to the statement made by Atty Schmidt.
Court makes statements regarding element #2 and the changes that are being requested.
Atty Schmidt has an objection to the change of element #2.
8:54 a.m.  Court makes statements indicating that he will be submitting the change that the State has requested.
8:59 a.m.  Court continues with the review of the Jury Instructions.
Atty Cousins questions if exhibits are covered under 103 as evidence defined.
Court reviews this part of the Jury Instructions.
This portion of the Jury Instruction to remain as is.
484 to be changed on Jury Instructions.
9:05 a.m.  Court reviews the changes made on 6037B. 
Both parties review the change on 6037B and do not see any typographical errors.
9:11 a.m.  Court takes a brief 5 minute break. 
9:17 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Jurors have returned to the courtroom.
Court explains to the jurors the long wait prior to the juror's being brought back into the courtroom and apologizes for that wait.
*****Alternate Juror chosen is #2402 and dismissed*****
Alternate Juror is thanked for his service.
Court review's the Jury Instructions with the remaining Jurors.
9:40 a.m.  Atty Cousins gives closing argument.
10:04 a.m.  Atty Schmidt gives closing argument.
10:26 a.m.  Atty Cousins gives rebuttal.
10:39 a.m.  Jurors are informed of the information on the Verdict form's.
Juror's are informed of the procedures while they are deliberating.
10:44 a.m.  Clerk administers the Oath of Officers.
Jurors will begin their deliberations.
Court informed all parties that there were some changes made on the Jury Instructions; corrected copies provided to the copies.
States position on exhibit's along with the defense is to wait for the Juror's to ask for them.
Atty Cousins has an observation on the Jury Instructions (115). 
Court makes statements regarding this observation.
10:49 a.m.  Court is in recess.
11:48 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Jury has question on elements.  Court reads question to the parties.
Atty Cousins gives his interpretation to the question of the Jury.
Atty Schmidt gives his interpretation of the question by the Jury.
11:50 a.m.  Court sends back note requesting a clarification of the question of the Jury.
12:01 p.m.  Court has received the clarified question from the Jury.
Court will listen to suggestions from the State and the Defense.
12:06 p.m.  Court responds to the question with the input of the State and Defense.
Court is again in recess.
12:23 p.m.  Court is back in session as the Juror's have reached a verdict.
12:24 p.m.  Juror's have returned to the Court.
Court read's the Verdict's and poll's the Juror's as to what their verdict was on all count's.
Juror's are thanked for their service and are excused.
Atty Cousins has a motion to enter Judgment on all counts.


BY THE COURT:
Judgment of Conviction to be entered on all counts of GUILTY.
PSI ordered. 
Sentencing hearing set for December 16, 2014 at 3:30 p.m.
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.

12:31 p.m.  Court is in recess.















  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This is scheduled as the first day of a two day jury trial.

8:49 AM Court calls case.
Court welcomes all potential jurors.
Court states appearances.
Court reads a part of the information, addresses the charges.
Court introduces counsel and announces witnesses that may be called in the case.

8:54 AM Voir Dire Oath is given to all potential jurors.

8:55 AM Clerk draws 23 potential jurors from the tumbler.

9:05 AM Voir Dire by the Court.
Juror #2428 is excused (striken for cause) and replaced by Juror #2511.

9:22 AM Voir Dire by Atty Cousins.

9:42 AM Voir Dire by Atty Schmidt.
Atty Schmidt requests Juror #2498 to be striken for cause.

BY THE COURT:
Court denies the request for Juror #2498 be striken.

9:49 AM Strikes are held at this time.
Jurors selected to try this case are:

Juror #2379 S.W.
Juror #2391 K.L.
Juror #2396 W.T.
Juror #2402 A.S.
Juror #2445 D.W.
Juror #2456 M.W.
Juror #2471 A.S.
Juror #2479 E.B.H.
Juror #2505 M.R.
Juror #2511 J.S.
Juror #2519 L.P.
Juror #2526 W.H.
Juror #2534 P.J.

Both counsel reflect that these are the jurors that are selected.

10:01 AM Court thanks remaining jurors and are excused at this time.

10:03 AM Clerk administers Jurors Oath to the panel.
Court addresses Jurors regarding housekeeping issues and instructions.

10:14 AM Court will take a 20 minute recess.

10:38 AM Court is back in session, outside the presence of the jurors.

Court reviews motions in limine at this time, for the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court will advise attorneys to advise witnesses to not bring up other acts.
There is a stipulation as to the number of crimes that will be addressed.
There is no reason to sequester the jury.
Court will sequester witnesses except for the Officer who is sitting at counsel's table.
There is a stipulation that Defendant qualifies for a repeat offender status.
Defense is to not call witnesses that were not listed on the witness list.

Atty Renc wrote a letter to the Court, regarding her client, who is a witness on this case, will be pleading the fifth. Atty Cousins has not made a decision on this at this time.

10:44 AM Jurors enter the Courtroom.
Court advises Jurors that they will not have a transcript of today's proceedings for deliberation.
Notetaking will be permitted. Jurors can ask written questions, after both lawyers have finished questioning a witness, if desired. Questions are to be directed to witness. Court will determine if question is allowable. 

10:49 AM Atty Cousins gives opening statements.

11:00 AM Atty Schmidt gives opening statements.

11:04 AM Notepads and pencils are given to Jurors at this time.

State is ready to proceed.

11:05 AM Michael Schultz is called and sworn in, narcotic detective with City of Stevens Point.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Exhibits #1-#5 are marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.
Exhibits #1-#5 are offered and received.
Exhibits #3-#5 are published to the jury.
Exhibits #7-#8 are marked on behalf of Plaintiff.
Exhibits #6-#9 are offered and received.
Exhibits #6 and #9 are published to the jury.
Exhibits #10-#14 are marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.
Exhibits #12-#14 are offered and received.
Exhibits #13 and #14 are published to the jury.
11:32 AM Atty Cousins requests to stop this witness' testimony in order for another witness to speak yet this morning. Witness is not present at this time, Atty Cousins continues.
Exhibits #15 and #16 are marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.

11:34 AM Witness is excused for this moment, for another witness to be examined, she is present now.

11:35 AM Madison Kniskern is called and sworn in, controlled substance analyst.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibit #17 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.
Exhibits #1 and #2 and #7 and #8 and #10 are referred to.
Exhibit #17 is offered and received.
11:48 AM Cross-examination by Atty Schmidt.
11:53 AM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
11:55 AM No questions by the Jurors. Witness is excused.

It is just about noon, Court will take noon recess at this time. Court gives a few reminders to the Jurors.
Court advises jurors to return between 1:20 PM - 1:30 PM.
Court will continue at 1:30 PM.

11:57 AM Court is in recess.
All exhibits are accounted for.

(Exhibits #7, #8 and #12 were opened in Court)

1:30 PM Court is back on the record, outside of the presence of the jury.
Same appearances as this morning.

Neither counsel have anything to addresses at this time.

1:31 PM Jurors enter the courtroom.

1:32 PM Direct examination of Mr. Schultz by Atty Cousins continues.
Exhibit #18 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.

1:50 PM Atty Schmidt objects - Jurors are taken outside of the presence of the objection. 
Court addresses members sitting in the back regarding about standing up when the Court stands.  
Atty Schmidt addresses the Court regarding objection. Court reviews Exhibit #18, text number 22 in particular. 
Mr. Schultz explains. 
Atty Cousins addresses the Court, it is not heresay.
Atty Schmidt replies.
Discussion continues among counsel and Court.
BY THE COURT:
Court overrules the objection. It is not within the heresay rule.

2:02 PM Jurors enter the courtroom.

2:03 PM Direct examination of Mr. Schultz by Atty Cousins continues.
Exhibit #19 is marked on behalf of Plaintiff.
Exhibits #18 and #19 are offered and received.
Exhibit #15 is referred to.
(Exhibit #15 is opened in Court)
Exhibits #20-#23 are marked on behalf of Plaintiff.
Exhibits #15, #16 and #20-#23 are offered and received.
Exhibit #19 is referred to.
2:22 PM Cross-examination by Atty Schmidt.
Exhibits #3-#5, and #23 are referred to.
3:04 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
3:10 PM Re-cross by Atty Schmidt.

3:13 PM Court will take a 20 minute afternoon recess at this time. Court reminds Jurors not to talk about this matter and all the other instructions previously addressed. 

3:44 PM Court is back in session.
Atty Cousins moves Exhibits #10 and #11 into evidence.
Exhibits #10 and #11 are offered and received.
State rests.

Atty Schmidt is ready to proceed.
Defendant will be testifying.
Atty Schmidt moves to dismiss Count 1 for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Cousins replies, requests the Court to deny the defense motion.

3:58 PM Jurors enter the courtroom.
Court apologizes for the wait. There is a legal argument that will take another 15-20 minutes to put on the record.
Court will excuse the Jurors for the day.
Court reminds the Jurors to not discuss the case with anyone and reminds Jurors about instructions earlier stated.

Jurors are asked to return tomorrow at 8:20 AM. Court will begin at 8:30 AM.
Notepads will be collected and kept in a locked area.

4:01 PM Court reviews the file.
Court needs clarifications. Court has read the complaint and information.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court, charge would be under manufacturing.
The testimony of the Officer, while be cross-examined, was never said that Defendant packaged drugs at the residence. Defendant never said he sold drugs at the residence. Officer didn't witness anyone coming in or out of the residence. 

4:10 PM Court retrieves a couple more books from chambers.
Earlier this week or even last week, Court advised counsel off the record that this Court has not had a jury trial on this charge and does not remember seeing this charge that often. Atty Cousins stated that he charges this charge all the time.

Court reviews the jury instructions.

BY THE COURT:
Court will enter an order denying the motion to dismiss Count 1.

Court wants all parties to be present by 8:15 AM, to go through the collegque with the Defendant regarding testifying.

Atty Renc is present, represents the witness. 
Atty Renc inquires if her witness is excused from subpoena.
Atty Cousins will excuse witness from subpoena, will not be called.

4:25 PM Court is in recess.

All exhibits are accounted for.
Exhibits #1 and #2 are given to Officer Schultz for safekeeping for the evening.
Defendant's
Defendant's
State's (Amended to reflect accurate prior convictions
and Notice of Motion

3:08 p.m. Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion for withdrawal of Counsel by Defendant.  Court questions the reasons for motion.  Atty Schmidt that he is ready for Jury trial this Weds 09-17-14, unless there is information that with the ADA or his client has not informed him of then he would not be ready. 
09-29-14 at 1:30 for 14CF339: Bond set:  $1,000 sig bond: Comply with all conditions in 14CF33 and 14CF302.

Defendant Todd A. Burg in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess any illegal drugs.
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances or illegal drugs without a valid prescription.

Defendant Todd A. Burg in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Defendant indicates they had applied at Public Defender and does qualify. 

Court will adjourn to allow defendant to obtain counsel. 

Atty Counsel recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
